intro: Ptilotus helipteroides, commonly known as the stinkwort, is an herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its branched, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces tiny, greenish-yellow flowers that are often surrounded by bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Ptilotus helipteroides is also known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is a defense mechanism against herbivores.
